isis.stitle: TSI 01-03-06 - Improved Barksdale Air Suspension Height Control Valve with Integral Dump Feature is Standard on 9000i Models Built After September 1, 2000 and is Available for Retrofit in 9000i and 9000 Models Built Before September 1, 2000 with a 9 1/2 Inch Ride Height (12 1/2 Inch Air Bag Height)

subjectgroup.subject: Improved Barksdale Air Suspension Height Control Valve with Integral Dump Feature is Standard on 9000i Models Built After September 1, 2000 and is Available for Retrofit in 9000i and 9000 Models Built Before September 1, 2000 with a 9 1/2 Inch Ride Height (12 1/2 Inch Air Bag Height)

geninfo.para: An improved Barksdale air suspension height control valve with integral dump feature was implemented in production, starting September 1, 2000, for 9000i Models. All Barksdale control valves now include the integral dump feature and can be retrofitted to earlier 9000i and 9000 conventional Models and other International models with International air suspension systems that have 9 1/2 inch ride height. The Barksdale valve may also be used as a replacement for Midland and Ridewell height control valves.

note.para: Ride height is defined as the measurement from the bottom of the frame rail to the centerline of the axle shaft and not to be confused with air spring height (air bag), which is 12 1/2 inches for these suspensions.
Refer to TSI-94-03-02RA for ride height versus air bag settings

svcproc.title: Retrofitting a Barksdale Height Control Valve for Midland or Ridewell Valves
svcproc.para: To retrofit a Barksdale valve for a Midland or Ridewell height control valve in a chassis with an International air suspension the existing mounting bracket must be modified or a new bracket can be ordered (Refer to Table 1, Parts information).
To modify the existing bracket, drill a 9/32 inch hole as shown in Figure 2. The modification can be made without removing the bracket in most cases.

item.para: Install the height control valve to the mounting bracket with the 1/4-20 UNC-2A studs (Figure 1, Item 9). Tighten the nuts to 55 to 70 Lbf-in (6 to 8 Nm) of torque.
All air fittings are 1/4 inch NPT.
Use Teflon tape or pipe dope on the air fitting threads.
Install the air fittings hand tight plus 1/2 to 2 additional turns.
If the height control valve integral dump feature will not be used, the valve dump control port (Figure 1, Item 1) does not need to be plugged.
The air supply connects to the port identified "I/E" (Figure 1, Item 6).
The air springs may be connected to ports identified "C1" and "C2" (Figure 1, Item 5 and Item 8). Either port may be used as a single air spring source by plugging the other port.

step1.para: Move the height control valve lever to the horizontal position as shown in Figure 1. The lever can be held in this position by installing a 0.171 inch diameter rod through the lever and into the hole provided in the valve. A golf tee can also be used (Figure 1, Item 10).
Install the vertical linkage. If a universal linkage is used, it can be cut to the required length.
Set the ride height to 9 1/2 inches (12 1/2 inch air bag height). Refer to TSI-94-03-02RA.
